abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Initiatives for
            Local Governance Reform Project for Indonesia is to pilot
            support to district (labupaten) governments in improving
            transparency, accountability and public participatory
            practices and in undertaking reforms in financial management
            and procurement. The Borrower's changes include: (i)
            reducing the planned number of participating districts; (ii)
            completing the final round of reforms, simplify the
            reporting of reform requirements, and discontinue reform
            requirements that will be difficult to achieve within the
            next two years; (iii) providing additional incentives to
            performing districts; (iv) improving implementation support;
            and (v) reallocating the un-disbursed grant amounts to
            subprojects. This project paper also proposes to extend the
            closing date of the loan and credit by twenty-four months to
            September 2011, and the Department for International
            Development (DFID) grant by fifteen months to December 2010.
            These changes are expected to enable the project to focus on
            the existing participating districts and support them in
            achieving the development objectives in the next two years.
